chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ERIN J MELTZ

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:05 PM Defendant ERIN J MELTZ appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for ERIN J MELTZ.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Atty Zamzow states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Zamzow. Attorney Zamzow waives any reading. Atty Zamzow states the defendant stands mute. Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on December 5, 2022 at 10;30 am.

Court adjourned at 3:08 PM

Defendant phoned wondering whether she could appear by zoom today because it was a rescheduled hearing, and the original hearing was scheduled via zoom. She was given permission to appear by zoom at 3:00 p.m. today.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Defendant ERIN J MELTZ appeared by phone.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies but no attorney has been appointed as of yet. Court adjourns to October 4, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Court will look at possibly appointing counsel at that time. Zoom ok.

Defendant called Clerk of Courts and stated she is unable to appear in person today. She was given Zoom instructions and will appear via telephone. Defendant confirmed phone number and address on file are correct.

Warrant cancelled - spoke to Sam from dispatch.
Warrant cancelled - spoke to Sam from dispatch.

1:09 PM Defendant ERIN J MELTZ appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Statement by defendant regarding bond. Court sets bond at $250 signature bond. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant would like to look at getting an attorney. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:12 PM.
Sent to GLSO on April 6, 2022.
